com.tightdb
Class Row

java.lang.Object
  com.tightdb.Row
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Row
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is the base class for a specific row of a table. If we want to create a table of a specific structure (schema) we first define a row by subclassing this class, add the attributes of the table (schema). As an example let us consider the case of maintaining collection of employees. Each employee has "First Name", "Last Name", Age, and two phone numbers (one for home and another for office). For this we declare a phone no row as follows. class PhoneNumber extends Row { String type; String mobileno; } Now we declare the row of the main table as follows. class Employee extends Row { String firstName; String lastName; Integer age; Table phoneNumbers; } At the last we create the Table of Employees as Table employees = new Table();
